message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a solution to the problem of long-tailed frequency distribution for labels in massively multi-label prediction/classification problems using a modified output layer of a neural network. This solution involves creating a Bayesian network of sigmoids that takes advantage of ontology relationships between the labels to share information between rare and more common labels. This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) as it deals with neural networks and classification problems. It could also belong to the sub-categories of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) as it involves ontology relationships and prediction/classification problems. Additionally, it could belong to the sub-categories of Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) as it deals with image and protein function prediction.
